      • add

        public void add(Storable storable)
         throws AlreadyExistsException
        Description copied from interface: StorageManager
        TODO: update this javadoc Adds this storable to storage layer, if the storable with same Storable.getPrimaryKey exists, it will do a get and ensure new and old storables instances are equal in which case it will return false. If the old and new instances are not the same it will throw AlreadyExistsException. Will return true if no existing storable entity was found and the supplied entity gets added successfully.
        Specified by:
        add in interface StorageManager
        Throws:
        AlreadyExistsException

      • remove

        public <T extends Storable> T remove(StorableKey key)
                              throws StorageException
        Description copied from interface: StorageManager
        Removes a Storable object identified by a StorableKey. If the key does not exist a null value is returned, no exception is thrown.
        Specified by:
        remove in interface StorageManager
        Parameters:
        key - of the Storable object to remove
        Returns:
        object that got removed, null if no object was removed.
        Throws:
        StorageException

      • addOrUpdate

        public void addOrUpdate(Storable storable)
        Description copied from interface: StorageManager
        Unlike add, if the storage entity already exists, it will be updated. If it does not exist, it will be created.
        Specified by:
        addOrUpdate in interface StorageManager

      • find

        public <T extends Storable> Collection<T> find(String namespace,
                                               List<QueryParam> queryParams)
                                        throws StorageException
        Description copied from interface: StorageManager
        Get the list of storable entities in the namespace, matching the query params. 
         E.g get a list of all devices with deviceId="nest" and version=1

 List<QueryParam> params = Arrays.asList(new QueryParam("deviceId", "nest"), new QueryParam("version", "1");

 List<Device> devices = find(DEVICE_NAMESPACE, params);
        Specified by:
        find in interface StorageManager
        Returns:
        Throws:
        StorageException
